author: cbc
title: HERstory in Black: DJ MelBoogie
text:
In honour of Black History month, CBC brings you stories from HERstory in Black, a Toronto-based digital photo series profiling 150 black women from the GTA and other parts of Ontario by How She Hustles, a network of 5,000 diverse women. 
INTERACTIVE:  Meet 150 black women who have made a place in Canadian history 
HERstory in Black: Camille Mitchell 
HERstory in Black: Jasmyn Fyffe 
​HERstory in Black: d'bi young anitafrika 
​HERstory in Black: Krissy Doyle-Thomas​ 
HERstory in Black: Akua Delfish and Onika Powell 

Name: Melissa Langley — DJ MelBoogie
What she does:  Melissa Langley has been a hip hop DJ for 25 years in Toronto and across the country.
HERstory in Black: Melissa Langley — DJ MelBoogie 3:01
What inspired your love of music? 
DJ MelBoogie: My dad, like a lot of West Indian fathers, had a huge record collection. Two of the first records that I had in my possession were The Breaks by Kurtis Blow and Super Rhymes . Those were so influential in developing my love for hip hop. When I started going to York University, I actually studied there to become a teacher. I taught piano for 16 years, classically trained with the Royal Conservatory of Music. I thought that was my calling, but then I started volunteering at CHRY 105.5, which it was at the time. I basically learned how to DJ and do a radio show on the air. 
DJ MelBoogie is among 150 black women from the GTA featured in a digital photo series called HERstory in Black. (Ebti Nabag)
